alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 17 at 9:41PM EST until December 18 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 9 AM EST Monday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two and a half to three feet above normal. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 5:16 AM and 5:49 PM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 6:14 AM and 6:39 PM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 6:50 AM and 7:15 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/05 AM 3.7 2.1 2.5 2.0 Moderate 18/04 PM 2.2 0.6 1.3 3.0 None 19/05 AM 1.4 -0.2 0.4 2.0 None 19/06 PM 0.9 -0.7 -0.2 1.0 None 20/07 AM 0.8 -0.8 -0.4 1.0 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
